com.stormpath.sdk.accountStoreMapping

Interface AccountStoreMapping<T extends AccountStoreHolder>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Deletable, Resource, Saveable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ApplicationAccountStoreMapping, OrganizationAccountStoreMapping

    public interface AccountStoreMapping<T extends AccountStoreHolder>
extends Resource, Saveable, Deletable
    An AccountStoreMapping represents the assignment of an AccountStore (either a Group, Organization or Directory) to an Application or an Organization.

    When an AccountStoreMapping is created, the accounts in the account store are granted access to (become users of) the linked Application or Organization.

    Since:
    0.9
    See Also:
    ApplicationAccountStoreMapping, OrganizationAccountStoreMapping

      • getListIndex

        int getListIndex()
        Returns the zero-based order in which the associated accountStore will be consulted by the linked Application or Organization during an account authentication attempt.

        The lower the index, the higher precedence - the earlier it will be accessed - during an authentication attempt. The higher the index, the lower the precedence - the later it will be accessed - during an authentication attempt.

        See the setListIndex JavaDoc for more information.

        Returns:
        the zero-based order in which the associated accountStore will be consulted by the linked Organization or Application during an account authentication attempt.
        See Also:
        setListIndex(int)

      • setListIndex

        AccountStoreMapping<T> setListIndex(int listIndex)
        Updates the zero-based order in which the associated accountStore will be consulted by the linked Organization or Application during an account authentication attempt.

        USAGE NOTE: If you use this setter then you will invalidate the cache for all of the associated Application's or Organization's other AccountStoreMappings.

        Authentication Process and AccountStoreMapping Order

        During an authentication attempt, an Application or Organization consults its mapped account stores in iteration order, trying to find the first matching account to use for authentication. The lower the AccountStoreMapping index (closer to zero), the earlier that store is consulted during authentication. If no matching account is found in an account store, the application/organization will move on to the next AccountStore (next highest index) in the list. This continues either a matching account is found, or until all account stores are exhausted. When a matching account is found, the process is short-circuited and the discovered account will be used immediately for authentication.

        When calling this method, you control where the new AccountStoreMapping will reside in the Application's or Organization's overall list by setting its (zero-based) listIndex property before calling this method.

        listIndex values

        • negative: attempting to set a negative listIndex will cause an Error
        • zero: the account store mapping will be the first item in the list (and therefore consulted first during the authentication process).
        • positive: the account store mapping will be inserted at that index. Because list indices are zero-based, the account store will be in the list at position listIndex - 1.
        Any listIndex value equal to or greater than the current list size will automatically append the ApplicationAccountStoreMapping at the end of the list.

        Example

        Setting a new AccountStoreMapping's listIndex to 500 and then adding the mapping to an application/organization with an existing 3-item list will automatically save the AccountStoreMapping at the end of the list and set its listIndex value to 3 (items at index 0, 1, 2 were the original items, the new fourth item will be at index 3).
        Parameters:
        listIndex - the zero based index
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • isDefaultAccountStore

        boolean isDefaultAccountStore()
        Returns true if the associated accountStore is designated as the Organization's or Application's default account store, false otherwise.

        A true value indicates that any accounts created directly by the application will be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since an Application cannot store accounts directly.

        Returns:
        true if the associated accountStore is designated as the Organization's or Application's default account store, false otherwise.

      • setDefaultAccountStore

        AccountStoreMapping<T> setDefaultAccountStore(boolean defaultAccountStore)
        Sets whether or not the associated accountStore is designated as the Organization's or Application's default account store.

        A true value indicates that any accounts created directly by the application/organization will be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since Applications and Organizations cannot store accounts directly.

        USAGE NOTE: If you use this setter then you will invalidate the cache for all of the associated Application's or Organization's other AccountStoreMappings.

        Parameters:
        defaultAccountStore - whether or not the associated accountStore is designated as the Organization's or Application's default account store.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • isDefaultGroupStore

        boolean isDefaultGroupStore()
        Returns true if the associated accountStore is designated as the Organization's or Application's default group store, false otherwise.

        A true value indicates that any groups created directly by the application will be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since an Application cannot store accounts directly.

        Returns:
        true if the associated accountStore is designated as the Organization's or Application's default group store, false otherwise.

      • setDefaultGroupStore

        AccountStoreMapping<T> setDefaultGroupStore(boolean defaultGroupStore)
        Sets whether or not the associated accountStore is designated as the Organization's or Application's default group store.

        A true value indicates that any groups created directly by the application/organization will be dispatched to and saved in the associated AccountStore, since Applications and Organizations cannot store accounts directly.

        USAGE NOTE: If you use this setter then you will invalidate the cache for all of the associated Application's or Organization's other AccountStoreMappings.

        Directory Only

        Stormpath currently only supports Directories (not Groups) as a group store. Attempting to set this value to true if the associated accountStore is a Group and then calling save will result in a ResourceException.
        Parameters:
        defaultGroupStore - true if the associated accountStore is designated as the Organization's or Application's default group store, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
